title: REI Danner Boots: The Ultimate Guide to Choosing the Perfect Hiking Companion
description: Complete guide to REI Danner boots featuring detailed reviews, comparisons, and expert buying advice. Discover which Danner boot is perfect for your adventures.
head:

    <script type="application/ld+json">
    {
        "@context": "https://schema.org",
        "@type": "FAQPage",
        "mainEntity": [
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 1,
                "name": "Are REI Danner boots worth the investment?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "Absolutely. REI Danner boots offer exceptional durability, comfort, and craftsmanship that justifies their price point. With proper care and Danner's recrafting program, these boots can last decades. The immediate comfort, waterproof performance, and superior traction make them ideal for serious hikers who demand reliable footwear for challenging terrain."
                }
            },
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 2,
                "name": "How do REI Danner boots fit compared to other brands?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "Danner boots typically run large, and the company recommends sizing down half a size from your normal shoe size. The DPDX last used in popular models like the Mountain 600 provides a comfortable width while maintaining a sleek profile. It's crucial to try them on at REI or order multiple sizes online to ensure the perfect fit for your foot shape."
                }
            },
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 3,
                "name": "Which REI Danner boot model is best for beginners?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "The Danner Mountain 600 series is perfect for beginners. These boots offer excellent ankle support, immediate comfort without break-in, and reliable waterproofing. They're versatile enough for day hikes and light backpacking while providing the durability needed for rugged terrain. The Trail 2650 is also excellent for those preferring a lighter, more athletic feel."
                }
            },
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 4,
                "name": "Can you resole REI Danner boots?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "Yes, many REI Danner boots are recraftable through Danner's professional recrafting program. Models like the Mountain 600 Leaf, Mountain Light, and Mountain Pass can be resoled and refurbished. This service includes outsole replacement, leather conditioning, hardware repair, and more, extending your boots' lifespan significantly while maintaining their broken-in comfort."
                }
            },
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 5,
                "name": "How long do REI Danner boots typically last?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "With regular use and proper care, REI Danner boots can last 5-10 years or more. Heavy hikers may need resoling after 2-3 years, while casual users can expect decades of service. The recraftable models can essentially last a lifetime with periodic professional maintenance. Factors affecting longevity include usage frequency, terrain type, and maintenance quality."
                }
            }
        ]
    }
    </script>

body:
REI Danner Boots: The Ultimate Guide to Choosing the Perfect Hiking Companion

After hiking over 500 miles in various Danner boots across national parks from the Pacific Northwest to the Rockies, I've discovered why these boots have earned their legendary reputation among serious outdoor enthusiasts. This comprehensive guide shares my hands-on experience with REI's Danner boot selection, helping you choose the perfect pair for your adventures. Whether you're planning your first day hike or preparing for a multi-day backcountry expedition, the right Danner boots can transform your hiking experience. Explore National Parks Store is your trusted source for authentic outdoor gear insights.

Table of Contents

  • My Experience with REI Danner Boots
  • Top REI Danner Boot Models Reviewed
  • Complete Buying Guide
  • Sizing and Fit Guide
  • Comprehensive Pros and Cons Analysis
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

My Experience with REI Danner Boots

My journey with REI Danner boots began three years ago when I was planning an ambitious trek through Olympic National Park. After struggling with multiple pairs of inadequate hiking boots that left me with blisters and sore feet, a park ranger recommended I try Danner boots from REI. That recommendation changed everything about my hiking experience.

I started with the Danner Mountain 600 GTX, and I was immediately impressed by the lack of break-in period. Unlike other boots that require weeks of gradual conditioning, I wore these straight out of the box for an 8-mile hike through muddy Washington terrain. Not a single blister or hot spot developed – something I'd never experienced with hiking boots before.

Over the past three years, I've tested various models across different terrains and seasons. From the technical scrambles in Glacier National Park to the desert environments of Joshua Tree, my REI Danner boots have consistently performed beyond expectations. The waterproof Gore-Tex lining kept my feet dry during creek crossings, while the Vibram outsoles provided confident traction on wet rocks and loose scree.

What really sets these boots apart is their durability. After 500+ miles of challenging terrain, my first pair of Danner boots still performs like new. The leather has developed a beautiful patina, and while the tread shows wear, it's nowhere near needing replacement. This longevity makes them an excellent investment for serious hikers.

Pro Tip from the Trail:

After extensive testing, I've learned that sizing down half a size from your normal shoe size is crucial for optimal fit. This prevents heel slippage on descents while maintaining comfortable toe room during long hikes.

Top REI Danner Boot Models Reviewed

Danner Mountain 600 Series

The flagship model that defines modern hiking boots. My Mountain 600 GTX features full-grain leather uppers, Gore-Tex waterproofing, and Vibram Fuga outsoles. The SPE midsole provides exceptional comfort and support for all-day hiking.

Best For: Day hiking, light backpacking, rugged terrain

Weight: 2.5 lbs (pair) | Price Range: $220-280

Check Price on Amazon

Danner Trail 2650 Series

Inspired by the Pacific Crest Trail, these lighter hiking shoes bridge the gap between trail runners and traditional boots. The Trail 2650 offers athletic performance with hiking boot durability.

Best For: Fast hiking, day trips, trail running

Weight: 1.8 lbs (pair) | Price Range: $160-200

Check Price on Amazon

Other Notable Models at REI

Danner Panorama Mid

Perfect for hikers seeking a balance between support and agility. The Panorama Mid features a modern aesthetic with traditional Danner durability. Excellent for day hikes and light backpacking.

View on Amazon

Danner Bull Run Moc Toe

Combining work boot durability with hiking comfort, these boots excel in rough conditions. The wedge sole provides stability while the full-grain leather offers long-lasting protection.

View on Amazon

Comprehensive review of Danner mountain boots by Rose Anvil

Complete Buying Guide

Choosing the right REI Danner boots depends on your specific hiking needs, terrain preferences, and personal comfort requirements. After extensive field testing, I've developed a systematic approach to help you make the best choice for your adventures.

Consider Your Hiking Style

Day Hikers

Focus on comfort and versatility. The Mountain 600 or Panorama series offer excellent support without excessive weight.

Backpackers

Prioritize durability and ankle support. Traditional models like the Mountain Pass provide superior stability for heavy loads.

Fast & Light

Choose speed-focused options like the Trail 2650 series for athletic performance with hiking boot protection.

Terrain-Specific Recommendations

Rocky, Technical Terrain

Boots with stiff midsoles and aggressive outsoles excel here. The Crag Rat series offers exceptional edge support for scrambling and technical approaches.

Wet Conditions

Gore-Tex models provide reliable waterproofing. I've tested the Mountain 600 GTX through creek crossings and rain storms – my feet stayed completely dry.

Desert Environments

Non-waterproof models like the Adrika series offer better breathability for hot, dry conditions.

Important Consideration

REI's generous return policy allows you to test boots on short hikes. Take advantage of this to ensure perfect fit and performance before committing to longer adventures.

Sizing and Fit Guide

Proper fit is crucial for hiking comfort and foot health. After fitting hundreds of hikers with REI Danner boots during my time volunteering at outdoor gear clinics, I've learned that most people make critical sizing mistakes that can ruin their hiking experience.

The Danner Sizing System

Key Sizing Guidelines:

  • Size down 0.5 from athletic shoes - Danner's DPDX last runs large
  • Thumb's width toe room - Essential for downhill hiking comfort
  • Snug heel fit - No slippage during heel lift test
  • Try on afternoon - Feet swell throughout the day

Width Considerations

Danner offers various width options for their popular models. The standard D width works for most hikers, but those with wider feet should consider the EE width options available in models like the Mountain 600 and Mountain Light 453.

Personal Fitting Experience

I initially ordered my normal size 10.5 and experienced heel slippage and toe crowding. After downsizing to 10, the fit was perfect – secure heel, comfortable toe room, and no pressure points during 8+ hour hiking days.

Break-in Period

One of the most impressive aspects of REI Danner boots is their minimal break-in requirement. Unlike traditional hiking boots that need weeks of gradual conditioning, most Danner models are comfortable from day one. However, I still recommend a progressive approach for optimal performance.

Week 1: Indoor Wear

Wear boots around the house for 1-2 hours daily to identify pressure points and allow initial conforming to your foot shape.

Week 2: Short Hikes

Graduate to 2-3 mile hikes on familiar terrain to test comfort and identify any hot spots before longer adventures.

Comprehensive Pros and Cons Analysis

After extensive testing and gathering feedback from fellow hikers, outdoor retailers, and online communities like Reddit and hiking forums, I've compiled a balanced analysis of REI Danner boots based on real-world performance data.

Advantages

  • Exceptional durability - Users report 5-10+ years of service with proper care
  • Minimal break-in period - Comfortable from first wear unlike competitors
  • Superior waterproofing - Gore-Tex models excel in wet conditions
  • Recrafting program - Professional resoling extends lifespan significantly
  • American craftsmanship - Many models made in Portland, Oregon
  • Versatile styling - Suitable for trails and casual wear

Considerations

  • Higher initial cost - Premium pricing compared to budget options
  • Weight penalty - Heavier than ultralight alternatives
  • Sizing complexity - Must size down, can be confusing
  • Limited breathability - Gore-Tex models can be warm in summer
  • Overkill for light hiking - May be unnecessary for casual trail walking

User Review Summary

Amazon Verified Purchase

"After 3 years and 400+ miles, my Mountain 600s still perform like new. Best investment I've made for hiking. The recrafting program means I'll never need another pair." - Pacific Northwest Hiker

Reddit r/hiking

"Sizing down 0.5 was crucial - perfect fit now. Love the immediate comfort and waterproof performance. Only wish they were lighter for long backpacking trips." - Colorado Mountaineer

REI Co-op Reviews

"Switched from trail runners after ankle injuries. The support and protection are game-changing. My feet stay comfortable all day on technical terrain." - California Day Hiker

Frequently Asked Questions

Are REI Danner boots worth the investment?

Absolutely. REI Danner boots offer exceptional durability, comfort, and craftsmanship that justifies their price point. With proper care and Danner's recrafting program, these boots can last decades. The immediate comfort, waterproof performance, and superior traction make them ideal for serious hikers who demand reliable footwear for challenging terrain. When you calculate cost-per-mile over their lifespan, they often prove more economical than cheaper alternatives that need frequent replacement.

How do REI Danner boots fit compared to other brands?

Danner boots typically run large, and the company recommends sizing down half a size from your normal shoe size. The DPDX last used in popular models like the Mountain 600 provides a comfortable width while maintaining a sleek profile. It's crucial to try them on at REI or order multiple sizes online to ensure the perfect fit for your foot shape. The toe box is roomier than many European brands but more structured than athletic shoes, providing excellent protection without feeling cramped.

Which REI Danner boot model is best for beginners?

The Danner Mountain 600 series is perfect for beginners. These boots offer excellent ankle support, immediate comfort without break-in, and reliable waterproofing. They're versatile enough for day hikes and light backpacking while providing the durability needed for rugged terrain. The Trail 2650 is also excellent for those preferring a lighter, more athletic feel that bridges hiking boots and trail runners.

Can you resole REI Danner boots?

Yes, many REI Danner boots are recraftable through Danner's professional recrafting program. Models like the Mountain 600 Leaf, Mountain Light, and Mountain Pass can be resoled and refurbished. This service includes outsole replacement, leather conditioning, hardware repair, and more, extending your boots' lifespan significantly while maintaining their broken-in comfort. The service typically costs $100-150 and takes 4-5 weeks.

How long do REI Danner boots typically last?

With regular use and proper care, REI Danner boots can last 5-10 years or more. Heavy hikers may need resoling after 2-3 years, while casual users can expect decades of service. The recraftable models can essentially last a lifetime with periodic professional maintenance. Factors affecting longevity include usage frequency, terrain type, and maintenance quality. I've met hikers with 15-year-old pairs that still perform excellently after multiple recraftings, making them true buy-it-for-life investments.

Shop REI Danner Boots on Amazon

Conclusion

After three years and over 500 miles of testing across diverse terrains and conditions, I can confidently say that REI Danner boots represent the gold standard in hiking footwear. They've transformed my hiking experience from dealing with constant foot discomfort to focusing entirely on enjoying the journey and scenery.

The combination of immediate comfort, exceptional durability, and professional recrafting services makes these boots an investment in your hiking future. While the initial cost may seem high, the long-term value proposition is compelling – especially when you consider the cost of constantly replacing inferior footwear and the priceless value of comfortable, blister-free hiking.

For beginners, I recommend starting with the Mountain 600 GTX for its versatility and proven performance. Experienced hikers seeking lighter options should consider the Trail 2650 series, while those tackling technical terrain will appreciate the support of models like the Crag Rat or Mountain Pass.

Remember to size down half a size, take advantage of REI's generous return policy for fit testing, and invest in proper boot care to maximize your boots' lifespan. With the right pair of REI Danner boots, you'll be equipped to tackle any trail with confidence, comfort, and style.

Ready to upgrade your hiking experience?

Visit your local REI store to try on different models and find your perfect fit, or explore more hiking gear insights at our homepage.

Continue your outdoor adventure planning
